column4: hey all...i rebooted today and lost all of my gnome configurations
wonderful way to start the day
and i was trying to set up my keyboard shortcuts
and for some reason the gnome-keybinding-properties dialog isn't recognizing my super_l key?
any ideas? xev properly recognizes it
xmodmap tells me i have two super_l keys
is there any way to get rid of that????
do you want to just use that key alone?   I can only use it as a modifier, like shift alt ctrl
yea i just want to use Super_L to launch a terminal
that's the way i had it before my gnome settings decided to crap out on me this morning
I don't know.  I just use the Menu key myself
gnome-keybinding-properties doesn't recognize that either
well, if your system crashed, maybe some of your files got corrupted.  It may be easiest to reinstall
easier said than done
do you have a separate /home?
the weird thing is, my system didn't crash
well _something_ went wrong, maybe there is a way to go back to the defaults?
yea, not sure what that would be though!
well, I do have a command in mind, but it is quite risky.  You would have to be prepared to reinstall anyway, as the command might make things worse
ok, listening
so you have all your data backed up?
i'm not going to run the command blindly, just curious as to what you're thinking
instead of /apps/panel  run it on just /                 btw, this is only a command to run blindly
